head.title: Edward J. Stern Wed to Ms. Rein

hedline.hl1: Edward J. Stern Wed to Ms. Rein

block.p: Stephanie Beth Rein, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert M. Rein of New York, was married last evening at the New York Botanical Garden to Edward Julius Stern, a son of Judith S. Peck and Leonard N. Stern, both of New York. Rabbi Marshall T. Meyer officiated.

The bride, 25 years old, is keeping her name. A graduate of Bryn Mawr College, she is a candidate for an M.D. degree at the Albert Einstein School of Medicine. Her father is the president of the CEI Group Inc. in New York, an exporter and distributor and an operator of retail stores. Her mother, Susan Lee Rein, is a supervisor of speech pathology for Community School District 22 in Brooklyn.

Stephanie Beth Rein, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert M. Rein of New York, was married last evening at the New York Botanical Garden to Edward Julius Stern, a son of Judith S. Peck and Leonard N. Stern, both of New York. Rabbi Marshall T. Meyer officiated.

The bride, 25 years old, is keeping her name. A graduate of Bryn Mawr College, she is a candidate for an M.D. degree at the Albert Einstein School of Medicine. Her father is the president of the CEI Group Inc. in New York, an exporter and distributor and an operator of retail stores. Her mother, Susan Lee Rein, is a supervisor of speech pathology for Community School District 22 in Brooklyn.

Mr. Stern, 26, is a business manager at The Village Voice in New York and a former reporter for Spy magazine. He is a graduate of Haverford College. His mother is a family therapist and family business consultant in New York. His father is the chairman and owner of the Hartz Group in New York, the merchandising, real estate and publishing company.
